intro: Diplogon pinifolium, commonly known as the pineleaf diplogon, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its needle-like foliage. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is native to specific regions in the Mediterranean. The plant features a compact growth habit with dense, clustered leaves that resemble pine needles. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Diplogon pinifolium is noted for its adaptability to dry, rocky soils and its ability to thrive in full sun.
